responsibilities: Ensure code functionality on actual surgical robots, not just in simulation.
Engage in honest and transparent communication to ensure the best ideas win out.
Take on more responsibility as you excel and contribute to team success.
qualifications: Ability to code in Linux and a system language like C/C++/Rust.
Strong understanding of engineering first principles.
Ability to work with high-precision, high-repeatability mechanical motion systems.
Ability to work in a high-reliability and fail-safe design environment.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed are focused on developing software for surgical robots. The responsibilities include writing software, ensuring code functionality on actual robots, and engaging in communication for team success. The skills required include coding in Linux and system languages like C/C++/Rust, understanding engineering principles, and working with mechanical motion systems in a high-reliability environment. There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on robotics, mechanical systems, and software development for high-precision tasks, which are not directly related to GenAI or LLMs.
